Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_TAG
Category.Description: This register contains the Matrox tag identifier string. Very convenient in debug mode for identifying the IP-Core register space.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_TAG_VALUE
Integer.Description: This is a 3 character string. The value is "MTX"

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_VERSION
Category.Description:
Register file version composed of 3 sub-fields Major version Minor version sub-minor version
v0.1.0 : First registerfile revision v0.2.0 : Added the fpga/board_info register

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_VERSION_MAJOR
Integer.Description: Indicates a major register file change that breaks software compatibility.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_VERSION_MINOR
Integer.Description: Indicates a minor register file change that do not break software compatibility.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INFO_SCRATCHPAD
Category.Description: R/W software debug register. Writing or reading to that register has no effect on the hardware.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_VERSION
Category.Description: Register file version composed of 3 sub-fields Major version Minor version sub-minor version

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_VERSION_MAJOR
Integer.Description: Indicates a major register file change that breaks software compatibility.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_VERSION_MINOR
Integer.Description: Indicates a minor register file change that do not break software compatibility.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_BUILD_ID
Category.Description:
The build ID is a unique incrementing 32 bits number used to identify an FPGA firmware. This value is simply the Unix time stamp (Unix Epoch)
Unix time (also known as POSIX time or UNIX Epoch time) is a system for describing a point in time, defined as an approximation of the number of seconds that have elapsed since 00:00:00 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), Thursday, 1 January 1970.
For more info https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_DEVICE_ID
Integer.Description: Lookup table providing the FPGA device ID. The value is user defined (project specific) and specified outside of this document.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_BOARD_INFO
Category.Description: This register report board specific information

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_FPGA_BOARD_INFO_CAPABILITY
Enumeration.Description: Report the board capability (Connected to the board strapping)

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPTS_CTRL_NUM_IRQ
Integer.Description: Indicated the total number of IRQ connected to the pcie2AxiMaster

EnumEntry.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPTS_CTRL_GLOBAL_MASK___value_is_0
EnumEntry.Description: Any enabled interrupt will bi signaled to the host
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Any enabled interrupt will bi signaled to the host

EnumEntry.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPTS_CTRL_GLOBAL_MASK___value_is_1
EnumEntry.Description: No active interrrupt is signaled to the host
EnumEntry.DisplayName: No active interrrupt is signaled to the host

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_CONTROL_NB_DW
Integer.Description:
This is the number of 32-bit DW used to represent all interrupt sources. It is used by the driver to know how to split the data of the interrupt queue in interrupt events.
This number should always be a power of 2 to simply the hardware implementation and avoid having a single interrupt event split by the wrap-around boundary.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_CONTROL_ENABLE
Integer.Description:
This bit is used to enable the interrupt queue. When disabled, the interrupt will behave in a legacy way where all interrupts are merged into interrupt status register and driver has to read the status register to know the interrupt sources.
To reset the interrupt queue, the driver should disable the queue and re-enable it. This will cause the producer index to be reset to 0 internally in the hardware. The driver should write the whole queue area to 0 to make sure it does not mis-interpret the data in the queue as events when the queue is turned back to on.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_CONS_IDX
Category.Description: The consumer index indicates up to which element of interrupt queue array it can write. Element in the queue between CONS_IDX (included) and PROD_IDX (not included) belong to the driver and are not written by the hardware.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_CONS_IDX_CONS_IDX
Integer.Description: When turning on the interrupt queue, the driver should first write this index to value 1023 (0X3FF) to indicate that the queue is empty.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_ADDR_LOW
Category.Description: This is the lower part of the address in host memory where the PCIe device writes the interrupt queue. It has to be aligned on 4K bytes boundary.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_INTERRUPT_QUEUE_ADDR_HIGH
Category.Description: This is the high part of the address in host memory where the PCIe device writes the interrupt queue. It must be written to 0 if the queue resides in the first 4 GB of memory.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_TLP_TIMEOUT
Category.Description:
Set the time out value.
When a transaction is initiate the counter is incremented at every. Each count tick is 16 ns. The reset value is 500 ms

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_TLP_TIMEOUT_VALUE
Integer.Description: Units are in clock tick. 1 Clock tick = 16 ns.

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_TLP_TRANSACTION_ABORT_CNTR
Category.Description: This register calculate the number of transaction that aborted du to a transaction timeout or an internal error. This purpose of this counter is mainly for debugging. Transaction abort should not occur in normal operation.

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_TLP_TRANSACTION_ABORT_CNTR_CLR
Enumeration.Description: This write autoclear field reset the counter value to 0.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPI_OLD_ENABLE
Integer.Description: This bit is a placeholder for the SPI_ENABLE in older version of the code. It is used both to define a field position in the .h file generated and to mark the bit as reserved in the register file to garantee that the bit will not be re-used in the future.

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPI_ENABLE
Enumeration.Description:
This bit enables the Output enable of the pin of the FPGA. This is needed to put the SPI interface in hi-Z when not using it.
Note that this bit has been moved from bit 24 to bit 25 so the existing software will not be compatible with new hardware and there will be no SPI transaction if old software is run over new hardware.

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPIRW
Enumeration.Description: Specify the SPI transfer type (read or write access).

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPICMDDONE
Integer.Description: Specify the last transaction for an SPI command sequence.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPISEL
Integer.Description: Selects the active SPI x channel.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPITXST
Integer.Description: Start an SPI transaction when 1 is written

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGIN_SPIDATAW
Integer.Description: This is the data byte to be written.

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGOUT_SPI_WB_CAP
Enumeration.Description: This register informs if the SPI core is able to write burst of 256 bytes to the SPI device (Write page), without requireing register polling between command, adress and data bytes in the write page command.

EnumEntry.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGOUT_SPI_WB_CAP___value_is_0
EnumEntry.Description: This fpga can't do write burst
EnumEntry.DisplayName: This fpga can't do write burst

EnumEntry.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGOUT_SPI_WB_CAP___value_is_1
EnumEntry.Description: This fpga is capable of doing write burst
EnumEntry.DisplayName: This fpga is capable of doing write burst

Enumeration.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGOUT_SPIWRTD
Enumeration.ToolTip: SPI Write or Read Transfer Done
Enumeration.Description: Specify if there is a transfer in progress.

Integer.Name: FIELD__PCIE2AXIMASTER_SPI_SPIREGOUT_SPIDATARD
Integer.Description: This is the data read byte from the SPI

Category.Name: REGISTER__PCIE2AXIMASTER_AXI_WINDOW_AXI_TRANSLATION
Category.Description: 32 bits window offset in the axi space
